text: this is a historic day I cannot hear you
very well but I can what I can tell you
is that this is a historic day for Cuba
this is the day that could change the
future of Cuba and that will appear that
will certainly change or start the
change of the relations between Cuba and
the US the US has imposed an economic
embargo into Cuba for 60 years and this
is the day when apparently in an hour's
time we know that President Obama will
announce that the US administration is
ready to start talks with the Cuban
government to reestablish relations
between the two countries and this
announcement today as I said before
could absolutely change the future of
Cuba the day started with the
announcement that the Cuban government
was releasing a u.s. prisoner in Cuba
he'd been Alan Gross had been in prison
in Cuba for five years he had been
sentenced to in Cuba for 15 years for
conspiring against the Cuban state and
let's remind our viewers that all he did
was he brought into the country
satellite communications for the Jewish
community and he was in prison for 15
years he has been released today we know
that he's on his way to the US and we
know that the Obama administration and
the Raul Castro administration in Cuba
have talked this has now been reported
that apparently Raul Castro and Obama
spoke an hour on the phone yesterday and
of course this is a groundbreaking this
is something that had not happened and
this just shows you the commitment
between the two countries to start a
process of reestablishing relations so
what President Obama will announce today
as far as we understand and then
President Raul Castro will also make a
speech in about an hour's time and we
will update you with what they have to
say is that they will announce some new
measures that will improve
communications and relations between the
two countries so we we can certainly see
a move towards establishing relations
between the two countries and that would
mean that would mean talks that would
mean possibly opening an embassy in
Havana
that would mean according to the Obama
administration that they will start to
see whether Cuba can be taken out of the
list of countries that sponsor terrorism
and that is something that Cuba had
asked before apparently for what we know
now the Cuban government has also agreed
to release all the prisoners prisoners
of conscience in Cuba's and 53 prisoners
in Cuba and as well the Obama
administration has agreed to freed and
returned to Cuba three Cubans that had
been convicted of spying in the US and
there were in prison with long prison
sentences in the US we've also heard
that they're coming back to Cuba so this
is the day that will change the future
of the island remember Cuba and the u.s.
have been enemies you know since the
1959 communist revolution and Fidel
Castro came to power and there have been
long-standing enemies and this is a day
when we are seeing from both governments
an initial thought and initial intention
re-establishing relations between the
two countries and that is at government
level it is truly significant just give
us an idea on a day-to-day level for
ordinary Cubans than many many Cubans
who live in America how much of a
difference
this will make look I think in Cuba this
news will be welcomed
I think this announcement today
absolutely undermines the US trade
embargo that has been imposed in 1960
even though the Obama administration
cannot lift the embargo because it's
lower it would have to be passed by the
Congress it definitely undermines the
embargo and that is something that not
just the Cuban government but the Cuban
people have been wanting also here in
Miami the Cuban exile community has been
changing we don't see anymore you know
most of the of the people here wanting
to strengthen the sanctions against Cuba
but you know we'll certainly see the two
opinions we'll see some people that will
feel that this isn't the right step that
the US should actually strengthen the
embargo and the sanctions against Cuba
so that Cuba makes some changes towards
democracy but we will see all the people
and all the lines of thoughts say
well you know what actually that hasn't
worked and that is what the Obama
administration is acknowledging today
that those sanctions have not worked
Cuba is a country were free of
expression freedom of expression is not
allowed there is only one party which is
the party in power the Communist Party
so you're not allowed to express
yourself freely but I think these
measures today will start a movement of
opening of openness in Cuba and I think
this will be a start of change in Cuba
